article.caption: Coroner: Cocaine killed Whitney Houston
Whitney Houston 'planned to remarry Bobby Brown'
Whitney Houston's daughter to inherit her entire estate
Whitney: 'I'm gonna go see Jesus. He's so cool'
Whitney's daughter rushed to hospital
Whitney Houston 'died of drug and booze cocktail'

articles.articlebody:
WHITNEY Houston's grieving family are begging cops to find out who gave the tragic singer the cocaine that killed her.

Heartbroken relatives are also urging detectives to investigate whether someone cleaned up evidence before police reached the hotel room where she died.

The Sun revealed yesterday that the Los Angeles coroner had determined Whitney, 48, drowned in the bath after taking cocaine.

A report said the illegal drug contributed to her death. Tests showed Whitney was a "chronic" cocaine user  and had a heart condition common in people who abuse the drug.

But no evidence of cocaine was found in the Bodyguard star's room at the Beverly Hilton  suggesting someone may have cleared it away before police arrived.

A source said: "The news Whitney was on cocaine is tough to swallow for her family. They thought she was clean of illegal drugs so this has reopened the whole thing. Someone gave her these drugs and someone is to blame."

Whitney's turbulent 14-year marriage to Bobby Brown, 43, was blamed for her descent into addiction at the height of her fame.

Mum Cissy, 79, fears the pressure of making a comeback may have pushed Whitney back on to drugs.

p.samson@the-sun.co.uk

image.caption: VIP guest ... Queen greets bride Frances Canning

article.caption: Queen's historic speech praises Brits and Duke
Tiny town given city status by Queen

articles.articlebody:
A LUCKY couple enjoyed their very own royal wedding yesterday  when their ceremony was gatecrashed by the QUEEN.

John and Frances Canning were stunned when Her Majesty arrived to congratulate them in person moments after they tied the knot.

The Queen and Prince Philip even took the time to pose for photographs alongside the happy couple.

John and Frances got hitched at Manchester Town Hall at the same time as the Queen was having lunch with 200 local volunteers in an adjacent room.

Hairdresser Frances, 44, of nearby Prestwich, said after her royal encounter: "It was surreal, I couldn't believe it.

"The Queen spoke to us by our first names. She said I looked lovely and she wanted to wish us all the best for the future. It was very special  it was so lovely that she took the trouble to speak to us."

Mum-of-two Frances added: "We're going to have to get a bigger wedding album now. Not many people will have pictures like that." Businessman John, 48, told how he chatted to Prince Philip while the photos were being taken.

John said: "He was a charming fella  for me it was the icing on the cake. We'll never forget this day and neither will our guests.

"If we can have half as many happy days together as the Queen and Prince Philip then we will be blessed."

John knew beforehand that the Queen was due to visit Manchester on his wedding day, and even wrote to Buckingham Palace to jokingly invite her along. He received a reply politely declining the invitation  but the Palace then secretly set up the meeting.

A royal source said: "The Queen didn't want to spoil their day, but did ask if she could meet the bride and groom."

The Queen was visiting Manchester as part of her Diamond Jubilee celebrations. She also visited the BBC's new HQ, Salford University and four local hospitals.

r.moriarty@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: ROYAL PICTURE EXCLUSIVE: HER Majesty congratulates John and Frances Canning
articles.headline: Bride's shock as Queen turns up
articles.subdeck: VIP guest ... Queen greets bride Frances Canning

image.caption: This was OK ... gay rights flag is flown at the town hall

article.caption: Pensioners' fury at council clash over solar panels
Parents banned from kids' football tournament
Council spends £100k on films about washing hands

articles.articlebody:
COUNCIL bosses were branded "a disgrace" last night for carpeting a worker who lowered the town hall flag after six British soldiers died in Afghanistan.

Weeks ago the same council flew a rainbow flag in support of gay rights.

But it could now SACK the employee, an ex-serviceman, for supporting Our Boys.

The man, whose military experiences left him with post-traumatic stress disorder, made his gesture after a Taliban bomb wrecked the soldiers' vehicle on March 6. On Tuesday, the day their bodies were flown home, he was served with disciplinary papers alleging "gross misconduct".

He is also being probed for failing to carry out a "thorough health and safety assessment" before flying the council's own flag at half-mast.

It highlights The Sun's Crack The Numbskulls war on council killjoys.

Friends now fear the unnamed worker, a Royal British Legion standard bearer, may harm himself because of Bassetlaw District Council's action in Worksop, Notts.

One said: "This is an outrage. The council knows about his stress disorder.

"They promote gay rights but have piled into an ex-serviceman for honouring six guys who died fighting for their country. This has sent the guy into bad depression." The widow of Gary Thompson, 51, the oldest serviceman to die in Afghanistan, called the council "an utter disgrace".

Jacqui Thompson, 45, of Nottingham, said: "How can showing respect to soldiers be misconduct? I applaud this man."

The council refused to discuss the case. But the flag of the local Mercian Regiment WAS at half-mast over the town hall yesterday in honour of a soldier killed on Wednesday. Five of the soldiers the worker paid tribute to served in the Yorkshire Regiment.

A council spokesman said: "We have a strong association with the Mercians. It is policy to lower the flag in the tragic event of loss of life."

a.parker@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: BASSETLAW Council branded 'a disgrace' for carpeting man who supported Our Boys
articles.headline: You mast be joking
articles.subdeck: This was OK ... gay rights flag is flown at the town hall

image.caption: High there ... workers at top of Shard

article.caption: 360 snap from London's Shard
Dub-high! Andy Murray has kickabout on world's highest building

articles.articlebody:
A FEARLESS construction worker dangles his legs nearly 1,000ft above London  as he enjoys a bird's eye view of the capital with two pals.

The men were 985ft up  three times the height of Big Ben  as they put the finishing touches to the steel spire of the £450million Shard building. Steel sections are being lifted by cranes to the top of the glass pyramid, where workers wearing safety harnesses bolt them together.

The Shard's spire is due to be completed next week. The shell of the building, which will house a hotel and posh flats, should be finished by June, but it will not be fully operational until next year.

When it is complete the Shard will become the tallest building in Europe at 1,016ft and create 12,500 jobs.
articles.teaser: FEARLESS construction worker dangles legs 1,000ft above London
articles.headline: Just don't drop the spanner
articles.subdeck: High there ... workers at top of Shard

video.caption: A PASSENGER was killed and 27 others injured after horrific motorway accident
PASSENGER talks of horrific moment that a lorry hits broken down coach on motorway
PARAMEDIC Nathan Hudson talks of initial moments after motorway crash

image.caption: Tragic ... one bus passenger was killed in the crash
M-Way death smash: Bus Driver held - Arrest after one person killed and 40 injured on M5

articles.articlebody:
A PASSENGER was killed and 40 others injured - two critically - in a horror crash involving a bus and a lorry this morning.

Police said the bus had broken down in the slow lane of the M5 in the West Midlands when a lorry crashed into the back of it at around 6.30am.

This afternoon, the 49-year-old driver of the bus, from Birmingham, was arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving.

A 35-year-old man from Birmingham died at the scene of the crash.

Images from the scene showed an articulated lorry branded with Fowler-Welch Coolchain embedded into the rear nearside edge of a single-decker bus.

Several ambulances and other rescue vehicles were sent to the scene on the southbound carriageway between junctions three and four.

West Midlands Ambulance Service said 40 people had been assessed and treated at the scene, and 27 were taken to four different hospitals around the region.

A spokesman said: "While the majority of patients appear to be walking wounded there are a small number with potentially serious injuries."

West Midlands Police said no children had been involved in the accident and confirmed that the driver of the lorry was among those seriously injured.

The affected stretch of the M5 is likely to remain closed in both directions for a considerable time and motorists are being advised to find alternative routes.

Eye witness Paul Guppy said there were patches of heavy fog on the motorway at the time of the crash.

He said: "There were fog patches, because I was driving through it with my fog lights on. That area is renowned for having fog, there's a lot of low-lying land.

"It was quite horrendous at the time, and then it cleared. Whether the fog was a contributory thing, I don't know."

The bus seemed to have been hit from the rear and was leaning virtually intact against a crash barrier, he added.

Artwork on the side of the bus shows Laurel and Hardy with the words "This is another fine bus you've gotten me into" - a reference to the comedy duo's famous catchphrase.

It is branded with the livery of bus company Stagecoach, but the vehicle had been sold by the company to a dealer 18 months ago.

The accident comes a week after 28 people - including 22 children - were killed and 24 injured in a coach crash in a tunnel in Switzerland.
articles.teaser: BUS driver is arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving
articles.headline: Bus driver arrested as 1 person dies and 40 are injured in M5 crash
articles.subdeck: Tragic ... one bus passenger was killed in the crash

image.caption: Joker ... actor Sacha Baron Cohen as Borat

video.caption: KAZAKHSTAN national anthem replaced by spoof version from movie comedy

article.caption: Jagshemash!  Kazakhstan replace national anthem with Ricky Martin song

articles.articlebody:
KAZAKHSTAN'S sport stars were left in shock after their national anthem was replaced at a medal ceremony  by the spoof version from movie comedy Borat.

The side-splitting ditty from Sacha Baron Cohen's hit flick includes the lines "Kazakhstan's prostitutes cleanest in region" and calls other nations "run by little girls".

It was mistakenly played at a ceremony for the central Asian nation's shooting team in Kuwait.

Footage from the presentation shows confused gold medallist Maria Dmitrienko listening to the anthem before grinning.

The Kazakh team's coach revealed organisers accidentally downloaded the wrong anthem from the net.

Borat's parody also brags: "Kazakhstan  Number One exporter of potassium," adding: "We invented toffee and trouser belt". It invites foes to: "Come grasp the mighty penis of our leader."

The music gaffe was the second to hit Kazakhstan's sports stars this month. Ricky Martin's 1999 No 1 hit Livin' La Vida Loca was played instead of the country's official anthem called "My Kazakhstan" at a skiing event on their own soil weeks earlier.

m.wilkinson@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: THE country's sport stars were left in shock after hearing the spoof version from the film
articles.headline: Kazakh stunned
articles.subdeck: Joker ... actor Sacha Baron Cohen as Borat

image.caption: Critical ... German Gorbuntsov
Banker gunned down in London - Exiled Russian in a coma after 'assassinatin attempt'

articles.articlebody:
A RUSSIAN banking tycoon was in a coma last night after he was gunned down outside his London flat by a "drive-by" hitman.

Exiled financier German Gorbuntsov, 45, fell in a hail of sub-machine gun bullets fired by the would-be assassin.

Blood was smeared all over the walls of the lobby of his exclusive apartment block and the bullets also took out chunks of the front door and smashed windows.

One witness to the terrifying shooting near the Canary Wharf financial district said Gorbuntsov seemed to be targeted by a drive-by gunman.

Bart Fogler, 27, who works on the front desk of a nearby block, said: "I heard from a resident the shots may have come from a car.

"I ran next door where I saw the shot man and his wife who was hysterical. I saw holes in his clothes.

"He was bleeding heavily. He was trying to stand but he fell to the ground."

Resident Lynette Johnson, 43  who saw the lobby after the shooting  said: "There was blood everywhere, all over the walls.

"The windows were smashed so he may have been shot through them."

Gorbuntsov  who used to own banks in Russia and Moldova  was last night under armed police guard in hospital where he was said to be critical but stable. His coma is medically induced.

It is thought he may have been targeted after he was named as a witness in the shooting of a Russian banker in Moscow in 2009.

He had apparently told his lawyer: "If I go back to Russia, they will kill me."

One neighbour last night said police told him Gorbuntsov knew the hitman.

The 54-year-old  who did not want to be named  said: "They mentioned that the attacker was known to the man who was attacked."

Former Kremlin adviser Aleksander Nekrassov said: "It looks like a contract hit because a sub-machine gun is not a weapon that would be used by some amateur."

The Met's Trident gang crime team were last night probing Tuesday evening's shooting in Byng Street, East London, which they are treating as attempted murder.

a.france@the-sun.co.uk

Pro killers on streets



THE attempted assassination of Russian Gorbuntsov is not the first time hitmen have struck in Britain.

In 2006 ex-KGB dissident Alexander Litvinenko, 41, was poisoned with radioactive polonium in London.

Russian authorities have refused to extradite the prime suspect, fellow former agent Andrei Lugovoy.

MI6 agent Gareth Williams, 31, was mysteriously found dead in a bag at his flat in Pimlico, South London, in August 2010. A couple seen there weeks earlier have never been traced.

And one of the most famous assassinations saw Bulgarian dissident Georgi Markov, 49, killed by ricin poison delivered by a pellet embedded in the end of a brolly on Waterloo Bridge in 1978.

The crime was never officially solved but years later two ex-KGB men said the Soviets were behind it.
articles.byline: By ANTHONY FRANCE and RYAN SABEY
articles.teaser: GERMAN Gorbuntsov in critical condition after being shot near Canary Wharf, east London
articles.headline: Former Russian banker shot
articles.subdeck: Critical ... German Gorbuntsov

image.caption: Set for boot ... Abu Qatada

article.caption: Exile hate preacher's web rants
Abu Qatada law ruse ruled out
May tries harder to kick out Qatada
Ken Clarke's torture jibe KOs May's Qatada talks
Give terror suspects MORE human rights

articles.articlebody:
BRITAIN may have to take back hate preacher Abu Qatada after he has been kicked out, Home Secretary Theresa May warned yesterday.

She admitted the deportation was "taking time"  but if she rushed sending him home to Jordan, European human rights judges could demand his return.

Britain has been banned from deporting the terror suspect, 51, to his homeland after he claimed they tortured witnesses.

The Strasbourg ruling led to him being bailed after 6½ years behind bars.

Mrs May has met officials in Jordan seeking a guarantee they will not use evidence from torture.

She said she wanted to make sure Qatada's deportation cannot be reversed before acting.
articles.teaser: BRITAIN is banned from deporting the terror suspect to Jordan amid claims of torture
articles.headline: 'Abu Qatada's exit could backfire'
articles.subdeck: Set for boot ... Abu Qatada

image.caption: Fabrice Muamba ... with fiancée Shauna Magunda

article.caption: Fabrice Muamba's family give thanks to fans
Fabrice Muamba was 'dead' for 78 minutes
Fabrice Muamba asks: Did we lose?

articles.articlebody:
STRICKEN Premier League football ace Fabrice Muamba last night asked fans to keep praying for him.

The Bolton midfielder, 23, made his plea in a statement released by fiancée Shauna Magunda and dad Marcel.

It said: "Even though Fabrice has made great progress over the last couple of days, he's still in intensive care and has a long recovery ahead.

"He has asked that you please keep him in your prayers."

Muamba had a cardiac arrest in a game against Spurs last Saturday.

He wasn't breathing for 78 minutes and doctors zapped his heart FIFTEEN times before it started beating on its own.

JOIN OUR CAMPAIGN FOR CPR IN SCHOOLS BY CLICKING HERE

He remains in intensive care at The London Chest Hospital in Bethnal Green as his teammates prepare to face local rivals Blackburn in a relegation clash today. Shauna, 27, who has a son, Joshua, three, with Fabrice, also "thanked God" for answering her prayers.

She said: "We've been overwhelmed by all the kind messages we've received. Thank you to everyone for the love, prayers and support.

"The support we have had from the fans, not just from Bolton but football supporters around the world, has given us so much strength."

Spurs star Benoit Assou-Ekotto, who was on the pitch when Muamba collapsed, visited him yesterday.

The Cameroon defender said the incident gave him "flashbacks" to when his fellow countryman Marc-Vivien Foe died from a heart-related condition during a game in 2003.

Assou-Ekotto was joined by teammate Danny Rose, who played with Muamba in the England Under-21 team.

andy.halls@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: THE stricken Premier League football ace has asked fans to keep praying for him
articles.headline: Fighting Fab: Keep praying
articles.subdeck: Fabrice Muamba ... with fiancée Shauna Magunda

image.caption: 'No idea' ... Ken Clarke

article.caption: I am so glad we were burgled...it exposed my father as a paedophile
100 perverts are chemically castrated

articles.articlebody:
THOUSANDS of child sex beasts will be able to hide their horrific crimes under plans put forward by Ken Clarke.

The soft-touch Justice Secretary wants to change the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act to let more serious criminals wipe the slate clean.

Anyone jailed for between 30 months and four years will have their offences struck from their criminal record after seven years.

Those currently jailed for more than 30 months have it on their record until they die. It means they have to alert potential employers when they apply for a job.

Figures seen by The Sun show if Mr Clarke's measures had been in place between 2000 and 2010, 3,794 child sex beasts would have been able to take advantage of it.

It would also have helped 11,684 violent criminals and nearly 1,000 other sex attackers.

Labour, who uncovered the figures, have vowed to fight the controversial change.

Shadow justice minister Andy Slaughter said: "It is proportionate that once non-violent offenders have served their time and kept on the straight and narrow for a few years, they should be redeemed in the eyes of the law and society.

"But Ken Clarke has continually shown he has no idea about public safety and how to deal with dangerous offenders."

Campaigners last night voiced their concerns at the reforms.

Jim Maddan, chairman of the Neighbourhood and Home Watch Network, said: "Everybody has the right to have a fresh start.

"But there comes a time when the public needs protecting, particularly when they have committed these types of offences. It would be wrong for employers not to know about who they are employing, particularly if a job gives access to people's homes."

A Ministry of Justice spokesman insisted public protection was "top priority".

He added: "Anyone applying to work with children and vulnerable people will always have to declare any convictions.

"Anyone who receives more than four years will have to reveal their record to employers.Other offenders will have to declare their record for up to seven years after their sentence ends."

k.schofield@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: THOUSANDS of child sex beasts will be able to wipe the slate clean under new plans
articles.headline: Ken Clarke: Let pervs hide horrors
articles.subdeck: 'No idea' ... Ken Clarke

image.caption: One-off .... Ferrari has promised never to build another like it

article.caption: The fastest Ferrari yet
Youtube Ferrari driver arrested for speeding
The 200mph new Lamborghini with no roof or windscreen
Yours for £1.5million  a 1953 Ferrari hydroplane

articles.articlebody:
ERIC Clapton has spent £3MILLION on having this Ferrari supercar specially built.

The Slowhand guitar idol, 66, was involved in the design of the one-off 202mph motor which does 0-62mph in 3.4 secs.

Fellow fans of the Italian marque got to briefly drool over the car as it went on show at a London dealership. But it caused such a sensation Ferrari had it whisked away on a low-loader.

Clapton, who is worth £125million, already owns a fleet of rare Ferraris.

His latest is based on a 458 Italia model  which cost £173,000 before it was completely rebodied. The revamped version does not even have an official name.

Ferrari has promised never to build another like it.

Thrilled Tim Burton  among supercar fans who glimpsed the beauty  said: "It caused a huge stir."

n.syson@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: GUITAR idol Eric Clapton was involved in the design of the one-off 202mph motor
articles.headline: Bet Ferrari goes like Clappers
articles.subdeck: One-off .... Ferrari has promised never to build another like it

image.caption: Snack attack ... one in the eye for pies

article.caption: So nasty to hit pasties
Osborne: We'll sort debt on never never
Bandit George has robbed our bandits
PM's 40p a unit war on bingers
1m more will pay 40% tax
Osborne: Elderly will not lose out
He's taking us for fuels

articles.articlebody:
GEORGE Osborne's new tax on pies was branded even more half-baked yesterday  as it emerged CAVIAR is exempt.

Upper crust fans of the posh nosh will NOT pay 20 per cent VAT since, unlike baked goods, it will remain zero-rated.

That is because it is deemed simply a "food" rather than a luxury like the sausage rolls and pasties Mr Osborne also plans to slap VAT on. He claims they fall under the category of "takeaways".

Yesterday The Sun's Page 3 girl Rhian, 25, joined her fellow beauties Sam and Amii to dole out sausage rolls to the public.

Rhian blasted the tax, saying: "This is a penny-pinching step too far."

Passer-by Dean Boezalt agreed with her as he tucked into one of the staple treats outside bakers Greggs in London's Tottenham Court Road. The hungry builder backed our Who VAT All The Pies? crusade to scrap the tax, saying: "Fuel, rent, everything is going up except wages. Now food. There's no need for this VAT increase."

Greggs' shares fell another £5million yesterday after Thursday's £30million plunge.

The National Association of Master Bakers  which is to petition No10  said: "People can't believe it."

The organisation's chief Mike Hollings warned: "It will push small craft bakers to the wall. The more you look at what they're proposing the more absurd it gets." He accused Mr Osborne of failing to think through how the tax will apply. Mr Hollings said: "If the products drop to room temperature we escape the VAT, so the joke is we should just turn up the heat in our shops to 90 degrees."

Business analysts Mintel predicted sales of sausage rolls may plummet. Its expert Kiti Soininen said: "It could encourage people to choose a sandwich instead." The senior retail analyst's warning came hours after Greggs chief Ken McMeikan vowed in The Sun to "fight" the Chancellor all the way.

Mr McMeikan said: "I don't think the Government has fully grasped the impact at a time our customers simply cannot afford it."

Her Majesty's Revenue and Customs confirmed caviar would not be liable for the new tax. Asked why pasties should carry 20 per cent, it said: "We apply the rules, we don't set them."

steve.hawkes@the-sun.co.uk

'Hit rich OAPs'

RICH OAPs should lose a chunk of their winter fuel payments to shield the poorest from the "Granny Tax", a Lib Dem peer said last night.

Lord Oakeshott, the party's former pensions spokesman, said it was a scandal half a million higher-rate taxpayers enjoy the universal handout.

It is worth £200 a year for over-60s and £300 for over-80s.

Lord Oakeshott said Chancellor George Osborne needed to get his priorities right and tax winter fuel payments to raise £230million a year.

He added: "When times are tight we must get taxpayers' cash to the pensioners who need it most.

It emerged PM David Cameron blocked fuel payments cuts for the rich as it would have broken a 2010 pledge. The row follows a freeze on OAPs' tax-free allowance in the Government's "Wrong Trousers" Budget.
articles.teaser: GEORGE Osborne's new tax on pies was branded half-baked yesterday  as it emerged CAVIAR is exempt
articles.headline: Madness of snacks tax
articles.subdeck: Snack attack ... one in the eye for pies

image.caption: Fury ... George Osborne's fuel tax is unpopular with MPs and motoring chiefs

article.caption: Madness of snacks tax
Bandit George has robbed our bandits
So nasty to hit pasties
PM's 40p a unit war on bingers
1m more will pay 40% tax
Osborne: Elderly will not lose out

articles.articlebody:
MOTORISTS last night called on the Chancellor to make a U-turn on fuel  as petrol prices soared above 140p per litre for the first time.

Unleaded hit a staggering record AVERAGE price of 140.2p.

It means the cost of filling up a typical 70-litre family Mondeo is more than £98.

Diesel raced to an all-time high of 146.72p. On the M4, it's 154.9p.

Motoring chiefs and furious MPs said the rise made it all the more unbelievable that George Osborne was pressing ahead with a 3p duty hike in August.

The AA said it meant TWO-THIRDS of the Budget's increase in personal tax allowance would be swallowed up by fuel price rises.

Tory Robert Halfon said: "If we stand up for hard-working Britons and get the UK moving again, cutting petrol prices must be the number one priority."
articles.teaser: MOTORISTS last night called on the Chancellor to make a U-turn on fuel  as petrol prices soared above 140p per litre for the first time.
articles.headline: Fuel plea as petrol hits 140p

image.caption: Wounded ... cop taken from raid by medics

article.caption: Dead...but why did cops let siege beast kill 7?
Toulouse killer is dead as 32-hour siege ends
French cops 'prepare to storm siege flat'
Gun fiend filmed school bloodbath for sick kicks
Hunt for 'Nazi' soldiers after four are killed in France school shooting

articles.articlebody:
THE brother of the al-Qaeda maniac who massacred seven people including three kids has said he is proud of the killing spree.

Abdelkader Merah, 29, was arrested as cops cornered crazed Mohammed, 23, in his flat and shot him dead.

The older brother is also linked to militant Islamic groups and is being held over alleged terror offences with his girlfriend and mother.

He told cops: "I am very proud of my brother. I regret nothing for him and approve of what he did."

His chilling comments came as new pictures were released yesterday of Thursday's raid in Toulouse in which Merah was gunned down by French special forces. Four cops were wounded during the 32-hour siege and one was shown being stretchered away.

Officials last night said an autopsy on Merah showed he died of two bullet wounds to the head and stomach  but was hit by 20 bullets, mainly in the arms and legs.

The terrorist staged a bloodbath at a Jewish school on Monday  killing a teacher, his sons aged five and three and the head's daughter aged eight. The week before he killed three off-duty soldiers.

Police believe Abdelkader may have known about his terror plans.

The brothers were involved in a militant network known as the Toulouse group which allegedly hatched a plot to attack a shopping centre in the city.

French PM Francois Fillon yesterday defended security agencies who left self-confessed alQaeda terrorist Merah at large to kill. He said: "There was no single element to allow for his detention."

Meanwhile, an English teacher sparked outrage across France yesterday after calling for her pupils to observe a minute's silence for "unhappy" Merah. There were calls for Lorraine Collin, 56, to be suspended from her high school job in Rouen.

- EUROPEAN security officials yesterday warned of the growing danger of home-grown Islamic militants who act independently of known terror networks.

n.parker@the-sun.co.uk
articles.byline: By NICK PARKER, Chief Foreign Correspondent
articles.teaser: CHILLING comments come after Mohammed Merah kills seven people in massacre
articles.headline: I'm proud my brother killed kids
articles.subdeck: Wounded ... cop taken from raid by medics

image.caption: Tears for her hero ... Christina Schmid recalls fateful day her husband Staff Sergeant Olaf died

article.caption: Commanding officer's tribute to 'six of our fallen brothers'
Christina Schmid: I had second miscarriage before Oz was killed
Hero's widow receives medal
Brave soldier's funeral held
Hero dies in blast on his last day

articles.articlebody:
WAR widow Christina Schmid read her hero husband's Tarot cards before his fateful tour  with nightmare results.

The burning Tower card, seen as the harbinger of doom, repeatedly cropped up.

It was one of a host of spooky premonitions she had both before and during hubby Oz's fatal five-month mission to the Afghanistan front line, where he defused 70 Taliban bombs.

Today Christina tells of the dreadful day he begged her to read his future  and the moment she saw his destruction in the cards.

In her own words, taken from her memoir about Staff Sergeant Olaf "Oz" Schmid, Always By My Side, she writes: "Oz asked me to do his Tarot cards.

"The Tarot was something I did very rarely, perhaps once every other year. I wasn't sure about doing it this time, but Oz urged me to and I agreed.

"I had done them since I was young and I seemed to be gifted. The card he chose to show the future was the Burning Tower. I did them again, this time for career, Oz chose the Burning Tower again. The worst card there is.

"It signifies death and endings, the worst outcome imaginable and entirely unavoidable. Everything you know gone in ruin or catastrophe.

Oz looked stricken. He said, 'I feel this is going to be a really bad year for me. I've got this feeling as if everything is slipping'.

"I tried to lighten it, saying, 'You'll probably just stub your toe when you're at work  you're always a screamer with loads of bad luck! Don't worry, it might just mean that you won't get a promotion or something'.

"'No', he said. 'It's not the card. That just confirmed what I already know and feel'.

"When it was my turn to choose a card I hoped I might get something that would lift the mood, but I was startled when I got it in my spread of cards, too.

"But then I got rebirth after, and the moon. 'See, hun  always light in the dark. Remember that', he said. I tried to hide my dismay. 'It's a dark time of year. Perhaps we're both just feeling it', I said.

" 'Let's be positive, forget the cards, we've got lots to look forward to', I chirped, waiting for him to follow my lead.

"He usually did, but this time Oz said, 'No, it's bad. I've got this feeling that if I go out after January or February, I'm not coming back. That's what my gut is telling me'. There was nothing I could say that would cheer him and the truth was it was hard even to try, because I felt worried too."

Despite the omen, devoted Christina put aside her foreboding when Oz was sent to the front.

During his dangerous deployment she would make a wish for his protection during the full moon.

But on the last full moon before Oz's return she inexplicably fell asleep with young son Laird and missed her routine.

She writes: "I woke around 4am, disorientated. I was fully clothed and Laird was asleep on me, in his pyjamas. As the realisation dawned that I had missed doing the wish for Oz, the moon had disappeared and I felt distraught.

" 'Oh my God, what have I done?' I whispered. 'I've done it every month. Why now?'

"I told myself it didn't matter, that it was just a bit of silly tradition, that I should forget it. But I couldn't."

Christina's foreboding grew to fever pitch shortly before Oz, who won a gallantry gong on his tour, was due home.

The spooky signs grew to the point where she says she KNEW he was dead even before the fateful news came with a knock on the door from two officers bringing confirmation.

She writes: "Two days before he was due to leave Afghanistan for home, Oz called again. I could hear immediately that he was low.

"He had been out of contact for several days and he sounded shattered. He said, 'Honey, I just feel really bad, I've got this odd feeling, like dread, I don't feel safe, it's bad. Have you got it too?' I had. In the pit of my stomach I felt a lurch as he spoke.

"I had been uneasy, anxious, and had a feeling of dread, but I didn't want to say that.

'You're tired,' I said. 'It's OK, you'll be back soon. Do what you did the last few months in the next couple of days, hun. You've got 48 hours left, that's all'.

" 'Honey', he said, 'I'm mentally and spiritually hammered, I'm hanging out. I've been away too long, worked too much.

" 'And if it's too much for me it's too much for anyone. But I can't let it show. I've got to keep positive and strong, they (the other men) have to trust me. If anything happens to me, I don't want them to blame themselves.

" 'I wish you could come and get me. I need you. Just come and get me now, honey'.

" 'I wish I could', I said, tears running down my face. 'But I can't. You've got to stop talking like this, you're just tired. You can push for 48 hours'. 'I need to speak to Laird,' he said. I handed Laird the phone and he went upstairs and they talked.

"When Laird gave the phone back, Oz said, 'I'm calm, honey, but I can't help how I feel. I don't think I'm coming back, 'cos I'm cuffing it now. I'm drained  it's hard to explain'.

"The next day I kept the phone beside me all evening, hoping he'd ring. I wanted to ring him but I couldn't, so that night I emailed  'Please email me, Don't go out on the ground tomorrow, cut the last day, don't do it.' He never got it."

That night Christina had a visitation in her dreams from another hero bomb hunter, Warrant Officer Gary "Gaz" O'Donnell, who had perished in the Afghan badlands disarming a Taliban device.

She writes: "I slept fitfully then I dreamed that Gaz O'Donnell was standing in front of me. 'Don't worry, Chris, I'm here to get him when he comes over,' he said. 'I'll hold him. I won't let go'.

" 'What are you on about?' I said. 'You've got no arms'. Gaz just looked at me and smiled.

"The next morning, Saturday October 31, 2009, I woke at 6.30am with a feeling I'd never had before. It was as powerful as thunder.

" 'It's today', I thought. 'He's going or has he gone yet?' I felt it so surely that it was in the floor beneath my feet as I got out of bed and in the air around me as I went downstairs.

"I felt numb, suspended in time, as I went through the motions of life. At nine I phoned my mum and told her I wasn't going to take Laird to his swimming lesson that morning. 'What's going on?' she said. 'You sound so quiet. Oz is home tomorrow, you should be happy'.

"I paused. 'He's not coming home, Mum, I know it'. "

Oz was killed, defusing a bomb, on Halloween while Christina was walking in the woods gathering her thoughts.

At the exact moment he died she wept uncontrollably.

Later in her book Christina reveals more spiritual happenings. She tells how Oz's spirit communicated with her through the spiritualist mum of a friend.

She writes what the spiritualist said: "He's saying, 'Coffee, white, one  man-up'. Oh, and what an awful taste, it's something like liquorice. What is that?' I smiled. 'His liquorice rollies, the menthol tips, he always smoked them. And that's how he talked'. She had his intonation exactly right.

"She always passes on an Oz message in his distinctive style.

"And it helps me to keep going and keeps me grounded."

d.willetts@the-sun.co.uk

Always By My Side, by Christina Schmid, is published by Century, £12.99. © Christina Schmid 2012. To buy your copy from the Sun Bookshop for just £10.99, with free p&p, call 0845 271 2136.

articles.headline: War widow predicted death

image.caption: Bust assets ... Tulisa shows off her cleavage in new track Young

video.caption: X FACTOR judge confirms footage is of her and apologises to fans

article.caption: Cowell: Sex tape Tulisa hasn't blown her job
Tulisa is dragged into sex vid storm
Will.i.am: Simon gives his acts the Cowell shoulder

articles.articlebody:
SAUCY Tulisa Contostavlos follows up her notorious sex tape by cavorting in a sizzling NEW one  but this time she WANTS fans to get an eyeful.

Telly's X Factor judge, 23, flashes her cleavage as she frolics with pals on holiday  in a raunchy pop video.

At one point in scenes for her new single she even bends over seductively to lick up spilt ice cream.

Another hot encounter sees her tie a man to a bed  and write on his bare chest.

The video emerged just hours after X Factor supremo Simon Cowell insisted the former N-Dubz singer's job on the ITV1 show was safe despite the scandal over the leaked six-minute tape showing her performing a sex act.

He branded whoever posted it on the internet a "scumbag".

An insider said as tight-lipped Tulisa yesterday continued to keep her head down: "She was thrilled by the kind words Simon said."

Tulisa's only comment was a line from her debut solo single  which the new video plugs.

She declared on Twitter: "Forgive us for what we have done, 'cause we're young."

A pal said last night: "Tulisa is still devastated by what has happened and is keeping a low profile. She is mortified that so many people have seen what is such a private thing.

"She wants to move on and put this behind her  and hopes fans will now concentrate on her music."

The Sun told yesterday how the ex-boyfriend Tulisa says appears in the sex tape with her  Justin Edwards  told her lawyers last year he had no copies of it.

The rapper, who calls himself MC Ultra, said: "Even if I did, which I do not, I would have no desire to publish them, simply because I would find that ungentlemanly. I was brought up better than that."

l.holmwood@the-sun.co.uk
articles.byline: By LEIGH HOLMWOOD, Deputy TV Editor

articles.headline: Tulisa's latest sex tape

image.caption: Terror ... binman Josef Kuzy

video.caption: SEE horrific attack as dog clamps jaws onto officer's arm during police raid

articles.articlebody:
A PREVIOUS victim of the devil dog shot by cops as it put five of them in hospital fumed yesterday: "When I told police they did nothing."

Scarred-for-life Josef Kuzy, 43, relived his terror as he showed off the teethmarks on his calf.

He was savaged by the crazed beast called Poison  thought to be a pitbull-doberman cross  as he cycled to work.

The binman, who spent nine days in hospital last year, said at his home in Stratford, East London: "The owners just said, 'Sorry mate'."

Neighbour David Tait said: "The man was screaming for help and the dog had him pinned up against the wall  his leg in its mouth." Musician Symieon Robinson Pierre, 25, of Stratford, appeared in court yesterday as three of the mauled cops remained in hospital awaiting surgery. They had swooped to arrest him for alleged kidnap and GBH.

He was remanded in custody at Thames Magistrates Court  also accused of having a dangerous dog.

c.grant@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: PREVIOUS victim of beast that attacked 5 cops says: 'When I told police they did nothing'
articles.headline: Cops 'ignored warning' about dog
articles.subdeck: Terror ... binman Josef Kuzy

image.caption: Date ... Charles Sherwin with fellow contestant Steph

article.caption: Bullied by web trolls over ginger hair ... 30 years on
Trolls' sick gags on tragic star Gemma McCluskie
Christine Bleakley says cruel net trolls won't stop her being on TV
Trolls target Military Wives choir

articles.articlebody:
A CONTESTANT on TV dating show Take Me Out has received death threats from cyber bullies on Twitter.

Internet trolls have threatened to kill Charles Sherwin, 38, "bottle" him, put rats in his house  and even set fire to his farm.

Charles, 38, said: "I am scared for my family and my livelihood  it's terrifying."

The abuse started after the farmer from Cheshire appeared on the popular ITV1 show. "I woke up the next morning and I already had dozens of abusive messages on Twitter," he said. "I've had people saying they wished I was dead."

Charles now regrets agreeing to go on the show, hosted by Paddy McGuinness. He appeared for two consecutive weeks after being picked to go on a date with farmer's daughter Steph telling viewers how they failed to click last Saturday.

"If I'd known I was going to become one of the most hated men in the country I'd never have gone on," he said.

"People said I was arrogant, flash and vain  I'm not any of those things. It's horrible and upsetting. "I don't know what I did to upset them but I wish it would stop. It's just a shame people feel it necessary to send such poison.

"I only went on the show to find love. Now I doubt I'll ever get another woman to date me again."

j.atkinson@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: CONTESTANT on TV dating show has received death threats from cyber bullies
articles.headline: Take Me Out star sent death threats
articles.subdeck: Date ... Charles Sherwin with fellow contestant Steph

image.caption: Strong stuff ... cider will hit £7.20

article.caption: PM's 40p a unit war on bingers
1m more will pay 40% tax
Budget 2012 offers crumb of comfort for workers
Shops to open for 24hrs on Sundays

articles.articlebody:
DAVID Cameron's war on binge drinkers was slammed by his backbenchers last night.

The backlash came as drinks firms threatened a legal challenge over the PM's idea that alcohol should be sold for a minimum 40p per unit  saying it breaches EU law.

It would end "buy one get one free" booze offers and set high-strength lager at a minimum £1.20 a canand set see a two-litre bottle of 9 per cent cider rise from £3 to £7.20.

Tory Philip Davies accused the PM of "living in cloud cuckoo land" to believe it will stem rowdy teen boozing.

He said as Home Secretary Theresa May unveiled the policy yesterday: "It's the nanny state running riot."

Conservative Therese Coffey said it could harm families who have to "budget carefully". And colleague Nigel Mills claimed more booze would be smuggled to the UK.

Furious drinks firms insisted the 40p tariff broke competition rules.

The Wine and Spirit Trade Association said last night: "Minimum pricing is illegal under European laws."

Labour's Eric Joyce, who drunkenly assaulted MPs in a Commons bar, said he was also against minimum pricing. He admitted on BBC's Newsnight: "This has no impact on people like me."
articles.teaser: PRIME Minster's 40p unit minimum for booze has been slammed by backbenchers
articles.headline: Cameron in 40p 'cuckoo land'
articles.subdeck: Strong stuff ... cider will hit £7.20

image.caption: Counting the calories ... 'low-cal' heroes Mars and Coca-Cola are joining the fight against obesity

article.caption: My 8-year takeaway binge cost £25k...and my unborn baby's life
You wouldn't eat 13 teaspoons of sugar in one go... so why drink it?
The Beast: Britain's biggest beef burger
Man's waist measures more than his height
'I'm the world's worst yo-yo dieter'

articles.articlebody:
BRITAIN'S biggest brands are going on a "diet"  slashing their calorie count as part of a war on obesity.

The number of calories in certain products made by soft drinks giant Coca-Cola will be cut by 30 per cent by 2014.

It will also pump more cash into marketing Diet Coke and Coca-Cola Zero, which contain no sugar, and increase their availability.

Mars bars will be cut from 300 calories to 250, and super-size "Grab Bags" of Walkers crisps, containing 263 calories, will be phased out and replaced with 185-calorie packs.

The move aims to take FIVE BILLION calories a day off Britain's national food and drink intake. More than two-thirds of adults and one in three 11-year-olds are now overweight or obese. Food manufacturers, supermarkets, pubs and caterers joined with the Department of Health yesterday to announce the "Responsibility Deal".

Producers including Hovis and Mr Kipling will slash calorie counts by 30 per cent across a third of their ranges.

Supermarkets will expand their healthy meal ranges and sandwich chain Subway will include five low-fat subs in its £3 lunch offer. Health Secretary Andrew Lansley hailed the plan as "a great step in the right direction," adding: "We all have a role to play."

Diet expert Dr Susan Jebb, of Cambridge University, said: "This programme is vital to tackle obesity. It's a very encouraging start, but it will take time to change the nation's eating habits."

e.little@the-sun.co.uk
articles.byline: By EMMA LITTLE, Health Editor and DANIEL JONES, Consumer Editor
articles.teaser: BRITAIN'S biggest brands are going on a "diet"  slashing their calorie count as part of a war on obesity
articles.headline: Top UK brands to go on 'diet'
articles.subdeck: Counting the calories ... 'low-cal' heroes Mars and Coca-Cola are joining the fight against obesity

articles.headline: Houston family: Find coke fiend who killed Whitney

image.caption: Night out ... Whitney Houston two days before she died

article.caption: Coroner: Cocaine killed Whitney Houston
Whitney Houston 'planned to remarry Bobby Brown'
Whitney Houston's daughter to inherit her entire estate
Whitney: 'I'm gonna go see Jesus. He's so cool'
Whitney's daughter rushed to hospital
Whitney Houston 'died of drug and booze cocktail'

articles.articlebody:
WHITNEY Houston's grieving family are begging cops to find out who gave the tragic singer the cocaine that killed her.

Heartbroken relatives are also urging detectives to investigate whether someone cleaned up evidence before police reached the hotel room where she died.

The Sun revealed yesterday that the Los Angeles coroner had determined Whitney, 48, drowned in the bath after taking cocaine.

A report said the illegal drug contributed to her death. Tests showed Whitney was a "chronic" cocaine user  and had a heart condition common in people who abuse the drug.

But no evidence of cocaine was found in the Bodyguard star's room at the Beverly Hilton  suggesting someone may have cleared it away before police arrived.

A source said: "The news Whitney was on cocaine is tough to swallow for her family. They thought she was clean of illegal drugs so this has reopened the whole thing. Someone gave her these drugs and someone is to blame."

Whitney's turbulent 14-year marriage to Bobby Brown, 43, was blamed for her descent into addiction at the height of her fame.

Mum Cissy, 79, fears the pressure of making a comeback may have pushed Whitney back on to drugs.

p.samson@the-sun.co.uk

image.caption: Trysts ... Rihanna in LA where she met hunk Ashton Kutcher

article.caption: Rihanna spotted leaving Ashton Kutcher's apartment at 4am
RiRi parties with her grandparents
Demi Moore airbrushes her troubles away
Rih-united with Chris Brown because he's 'the hottest star in R&B'
Seen a Ghost, Demi?
Ashton Kutcher's mercy dash to Demi?

articles.articlebody:
RIHANNA has been sharing a secret fling for the past eight weeks  with Demi Moore's ex Ashton Kutcher.

The 24-year-old singer hit if off with Two and a Half Men hunk Ashton at a mutual pal's house party in Los Angeles last December.

The Umbrella singer is so besotted with Ashton, 34, that she has asked about joining his Kabbalah group.

Rihanna and Ashton, who subscribes to the mystical religion, have been meeting up for a series of late-night trysts after the singer returned to LA to record her latest album.

She dropped in at his mansion around midnight on Thursday and stayed for four hours before being taken away in a car.

One source said: "The flirting began as soon as Rihanna and Ashton met and swapped numbers. That moved on to texts and arranging to meet. They snuck off to a Santa Monica hotel a few weeks ago.

"They are two single people having a fling, so thought it would be best to meet in secret.

"Rihanna has told friends he's funny and cute. Both of them love a good time and think they're too busy for anything serious just yet. She's starting to enquire about Kabbalah sessions with his rabbi."

Ashton has been single since November when actress ex Demi Moore filed for divorce  after party girl Sara Leal said she'd slept with him on his sixth wedding anniversary.

Ghost star Demi, 49  who wore a Kabbalah string round her wrist  has since been treated for exhaustion, substance abuse and an eating disorder. A source said: "Ashton does not want to rub a new relationship in her face. She's still vulnerable.

"He's a good guy and, with all Demi's recent health problems, people have forgotten that."

Rihanna hasn't had a serious boyfriend since 22-year-old Chris Brown  who once beat her up.

Although she comes from a strict Christian family in Barbados, friends say the singer is open to investigating Kabbalah.

A source said: "Rihanna does not go to church any more because she's simply too busy. She respects the religion enormously though.

"She is curious about Kabbalah so has started asking questions. She's open to new things and has always been a very spiritual girl.

"If she and Ashton are getting really close, she wants to be able to understand it."

l.nicholls@the-sun.co.uk
articles.byline: By LIA NICHOLLS, Deputy Bizarre Editor
articles.teaser: SINGER is smitten with Demi Moore's ex-hubby Kutcher after dating in secret for 8 weeks
articles.headline: Rihanna's fling with Demi's ex
articles.subdeck: Trysts ... Rihanna in LA where she met hunk Ashton Kutcher

image.caption: Sparkling ... Katy Perry in Berlin

article.caption: Katy Perry's man wants to be California Boy
Katy gives cheating ex the chop
Katy's Perry romantic trip to the City of Love
Katy's black and blue

articles.articlebody:
KATY PERRY isn't wasting much time getting over ex Russell Brand  she's heading for a romantic island holiday with her new man.

I say romantic... her Mediterranean break with French model Baptiste Giabiconi will have the added oregano of his entire family coming along for the ride.

Katy has been invited on the wholesome holiday after she hit it off with Baptiste's mum Marie-France this week.

They had an intimate meal in Paris and a source said they were a "match made in heaven" because they shared "God-fearing morals".

The pal explained: "Katy and Marie turned out to be a match made in heaven because of their similar religious backgrounds.

"Marie is really strict and Katy's parents are preachers in America, so it's helping along her relationship with Baptiste."

Katy and Baptiste will jet to Corsica this summer to a £5,000-a-week villa  with his mum, sisters, brothers, nieces and nephews.

And before the break wannabe singer Baptiste is planning to move to LA to be closer to Katy. The Chanel pin-up's spokesman said last night: "Their relationship is new, they're feeling it out but they're spending a lot of time together.

"He's considering moving to LA, at least for some time."

The break will be one of Baptiste's few extravagances as he doesn't blow his catwalk cash on fancy clothes and cars.

A source said: "Baptiste's only two big spends have been his apartment and a house he bought his mum. He will only ever shop for himself on the High Street at H&M and Zara."

That's a far cry from Russell. He loves his clobber  and even used to fork out for black toilet paper at £20 a roll.

Russell and Katy have signed divorce papers ending their 14-month marriage and a judge will make the split official on June 30.

Katy and Baptiste's relationship could make things pretty awkward for comic David Walliams.

Baptiste is good friends with David's supermodel wife Lara Stone  but David is a really good pal of Russ's and was on his stag do only 18 months ago.

He could always go swimming when that tricky dinner date comes along.
articles.teaser: KATY PERRY isn't wasting much time getting over her ex, Russell Brand
articles.headline: Katy Perry's 'romantic' break
articles.subdeck: Sparkling ... Katy Perry in Berlin

image.caption: Out soon ... Madonna's new album MDNA

article.caption: Madonna: I like to work with people who talk about philosophy or quantum physics

articles.articlebody:
MADONNA is back  bigger, brighter and bolder then ever  with her electrifying new album MDNA.

And you can listen for FREE with The Sun below.

The album will be released Monday, March 26 on Interscope, so this is your chance to hear it here first.

The Queen of Pop reclaims her crown with this her 12th studio album to date; a collection of shiny, dancefloor anthems set to take the roof off summer.

Co-written by Madonna, album highlights include the glorious William Orbit-produced I'm A Sinner, which recalls the heyday of Ray of Light, and Falling Free, a beautiful, soaring ballad.

There's a pounding clubland stomper in Turn Up The Radio, produced by French electronic DJ and producer Martin Solveig.

Then there's the poptastic punch of Superstar, featuring Madonna's daughter Lourdes on backing vocals, I Don't Give A featuring Nicki Minaj and first single Give Me All Your Luvin, feat. Nicki Minaj & M.I.A., which were both produced by Martin Solveig.

Renowned Italian electro house DJ and producer Marco "Benny" Benassi adds an extra sheen to salacious rave-ups I'm Addicted and Girl Gone Wild.
articles.teaser: EXCLUSIVE: FIRST stream of Queen of Pop's electrifying new album MDNA
articles.headline: First listen of Madonna album
articles.subdeck: Out soon ... Madonna's new album MDNA

image.caption: In the navy ... the band salutes

articles.articlebody:
JLS hitched a ride on a high-speed water taxi to get between their Sport Relief appearance and London's O2 gig last night.

They had an easier time than Frank Skinner, who faced his fear of water by swimming a length of his local pool for the charity.

But the lads will need just as much stamina over the next few months as their 4th Dimension Tour heads across the UK.

article.caption: Biz bites & showbiz snaps
Glad you came, boys?
US girl Want-ed a snog

articles.articlebody:
LONELY Max George is comfort-eating on tour because he misses his fiancée so much.

THE Wanted singer is desperate for Corrie actress Michelle Keegan to jet out and join the band in the States.

He said: "When I'm in the US all I'm doing is eating."

He looked hungry for something when he was drowning in bikini-clad girls at the band's Spring Break gig the other day.

It wasn't food.

image.caption: On his back ... Kaye Vassell on holiday with Dappy

article.caption: Brian May badgers Dappy into saving mammals
Tulisa and Dappy Twitter war over N-Dubz split
What 'jungle man' Dappy can learn from Bear

articles.articlebody:
WHEN most blokes upset their partners they turn to flowers or chocolates to patch things up.

But Dappy has another way to keep on-off missus Kaye Vassell happy, stumping up cash for her new modelling agency specialising in glamour girls.

A source said: "Kaye has always insisted she selects the women who appear in Dappy's videos.

"He was sick of it and said she would be better off setting up her own agency.

"He has put up the money to start the business, which will supply models for video shoots like his."

As long as she doesn't let Dappy do any private casting-couch business, it might just work.

image.caption: Stuck on you ... Professor Green and Millie Mackintosh

article.caption: Coldplay Chris mentors Professor Green
Professor Green isn't counting his chickens
Professor Green's outrage at Will Young losing Voice

articles.articlebody:
PROFESSOR GREEN has admitted he's impressed by his girlfriend Millie Mackintosh's posh family.

Her ancestors founded brands like Quality Street and her great-great-grandfather John Mackintosh nicknamed himself The Toffee King.

The rapper said: "It's nuts, isn't it? She was saying that her grandad or great-grandad completely changed what toffee is.

"Imagine that! Changing sweets. That's heritage."

That's nothing  Smarties are named after my family.

Apparently.
articles.teaser: THE rapper's impressed by his girl Millie Mackintosh's posh 'toffee' family

image.caption: Rivals ... BGT's Amanda Holden, 41, had a pop at Tom Jones, 71

article.caption: Britain's Gold Talent
Will.i.am: Simon gives his acts the Cowell shoulder
Simon Cowell: Voice rivalry is waste of telly fee
Judge and fury
Cheryl Cole Voices single in Simon Cowell snub

articles.articlebody:
BRITAIN'S Got Talent judge Amanda Holden ramped up the battle with rival The Voice with a sick dig at veteran star Tom Jones.

Urging viewers to watch her tonight instead of 71-year-old Tom in his spinning judge's chair on the BBC1 show, she joked: "He might be spinning in his grave next week."

Boss Simon Cowell looked shocked by her gag at the launch of the ITV1 show's sixth series. It followed her own near-death experience when she gave birth to new daughter Hollie.

But show insiders last night insisted Amanda meant no offence to the Delilah singer, adding: "She has the utmost respect for Tom."

A fierce spat erupted between the rival show's stars before they clash in a ratings war tonight.

Amanda, 41, joins boss Cowell and fellow judges Alesha Dixon and David Walliams on the ITV1 show.

Last night Cowell  who had been criticised by Sir Tom over his right to judge singers  hit back at the Welsh crooner's ability to pick wannabe stars.

He said: "Most artists who try and run record labels fail. That's why they are artists. Can a singer judge another singer as well as a record executive?"

The music tycoon also blasted "petty" Beeb bosses over the scheduling clash, laying the blame firmly at their door.

He said: "They're the ones who seem to be making it into a battle. We were always going to air in March because of my timings.

"The BBC are doing this as the more they talk about us the more headlines they get. But I don't like it when the shows clashes. It is petty scheduling."

But BBC1 controller Danny Cohen played down the battle for viewers, saying: "I'm not going to put a number on what we see as success for The Voice."

Yesterday Cowell said this year's BGT will be the best ever, erasing memories of last year's uninspiring run.

He said: "There's a mixture of good and what I call good old-fashioned British eccentricity.

"The best way to judge the show is not to take it too seriously, but the good ones are always going to get through and that is the important thing."

With a glint in his eye, he added: "There will be some strippers of course  one or two."

And he said there will be nine acts in the semi-final instead of eight, ensuring even more talent gets through.

Simon, 52, also sang the praises of Walliams, 40  who rose to fame alongside Matt Lucas in BBC1 comedy Little Britain. Cowell said: "I've been trying to get David to do this show for the past two years. There were these two bellringers last year and I texted him saying: 'It's you and Matt!'

"Some of his characters on Little Britain are like some of our contestants. I thought he'd really fit into that kind of British eccentric humour. He's been a revelation."

l.holmwood@the-sun.co.uk



Big Jon's a belter



UNLIKELY singing duo Jonathan and Charlotte have the judges wincing when they wander on to the BGT stage  but leave to a standing ovation.

Bulky Jonathan and his pretty auburn partner, who were introduced by their singing teacher, impressed all four judges with their performance.

Simon says: "Wow, wow, wow. Charlotte you are good but Jonathan you are unbelievable."

But when he asks Jonathan, 16, if he would continue solo, the hopeful replies: "We've come on as a duo and we're gonna stay here as a duo."

  • BOOKIES have already predicted that BGT will win the Saturday night ratings war  with William Hill putting the ITV1 show at 2/9 on and BBC's The Voice trailing on 3/1.

    A spokesman for the firm said: "The return of Simon to the BGT panel will probably be enough on its own to secure an opening week victory over the Beeb."

    TV recorders will be needed by those who want to see both  the shows overlap by 20 minutes.

  • Britain's Got Talent starts tonight on ITV1, 8pm



    'I've put it all on the line for show'



    Says Tom Jones



    SHOWBIZ veteran Sir Tom Jones told The Sun yesterday how he was staking his reputation on the success of The Voice.

    And he said he even fears taking abuse in the street if he gets it wrong.

    The 71-year-old crooner explained: "You are throwing yourself out there and making decisions. People at home could be thinking, 'What the f***? Why would he do that? What's the matter  is he deaf?'

    "When you are out and about on the Tube, or in a cab, the drivers are going to go, 'Hey Tom, the show is s***'. We have to make the show as good as we possibly can and whatever is thrown against you, fight back."

    BBC1's The Voice, which starts at 7pm, clashes with Britain's Got Talent, beginning at 8pm on ITV, for a vital 20 minutes  but Sir Tom said: "The ratings war is out of our hands.

    "As long as we get a fair crack of the whip, then it is up to the viewers. At the end of the day it is always up to the viewers."

    He added: "With some other shows, like BGT, all kinds of talent comes on. But The Voice is purely about what people sound like  that's the unique thing."

    Sir Tom  on the show with fellow mentors Will.i.am, Jessie J and Danny O'Donoghue  had warmed up for tonight's ratings fight by taking a stinging swipe at Simon Cowell.

    The Welsh legend insisted ITV show guru Cowell was NOT a good judge of singers because he has NEVER had a go himself.

    Sir Tom said: "I have problems when people who have never got up on a stage to sing judge those who do. Who are they to say?

    "Simon Cowell is a record man, not a singer. How can someone give advice if he or she is not qualified?

    "The shows with judges from other areas of show business are all very well and good.

    "But The Voice is unique because the four coaches are all singers, can all make records and know what they're talking about."

    The Sex Bomb and It's Not Unusual star believes he already has five potential winners lined up. But he told The Sun he hated having to dash hopefuls' dreams.

    Tom added: "That's the hardest part  sending people home. I don't like that at all. I have never had to do that before in my life.

    "When I have watched other talent shows and seen people getting all emotional, I thought that it was just showbusiness.

    "But when you are there, you realise how difficult it is. You have their future in your hands. It's not easy. In fact I'm going to be in trouble when I get home. There was a Welsh girl singing a Linda Perry song, very similarly to the original. I didn't pick her.

    "But I did say to her she hasn't lost forever  she is young enough to come back next year."



    No swear Script



    MENTOR Danny O'Donoghue says he is having coaching  to stop himself swearing on The Voice live shows.

    The foul-mouthed rocker said: "I tend to curse a lot so forgive me when I get to the live shows.

    "I'm in training now for the next seven weeks to not curse on the live shows. I'm very passionate and I have a limited dictionary to express myself with." The Script frontman said he had been impressed by the "nerves of steel" singers on the show so far.

    He confessed he would not have had the courage to audition for a TV talent show.

    Irish star Danny, 32, added: "I think in the day we are living every phone is a camera, so kids are a lot less shy."

  • THE Voice coaches got the shock of their life when Sam Buttery stepped on to the stage  after they mistook him for a girl.

    The youngster sings Adele's Set Fire To The Train on tonight's opening auditions.

    Sporting a huge quiff and a very retro style, he revealed The Script frontman Danny O'Donoghue thought it was a female singing, until he turned around. He said: "When he saw me, he was like 'oh... you're a man!"

  • The Voice UK starts tonight on BBC1, 7pm

    l.caroe@the-sun.co.uk
articles.byline: By LEIGH HOLMWOOD and COLIN ROBERTSON

articles.headline: Amanda Holden: Sir Tom could be dead in a week

article.caption: Cowell: Sex tape Tulisa hasn't blown her job
Tulisa is dragged into sex vid storm
Will.i.am: Simon gives his acts the Cowell shoulder

articles.articlebody:
SAUCY Tulisa Contostavlos follows up her notorious sex tape by cavorting in a sizzling NEW one  but this time she WANTS fans to get an eyeful.

Telly's X Factor judge, 23, flashes her cleavage as she frolics with pals on holiday  in a raunchy pop video.

At one point in scenes for her new single she even bends over seductively to lick up spilt ice cream.

Another hot encounter sees her tie a man to a bed  and write on his bare chest.

The video emerged just hours after X Factor supremo Simon Cowell insisted the former N-Dubz singer's job on the ITV1 show was safe despite the scandal over the leaked six-minute tape showing her performing a sex act.

He branded whoever posted it on the internet a "scumbag".

An insider said as tight-lipped Tulisa yesterday continued to keep her head down: "She was thrilled by the kind words Simon said."

Tulisa's only comment was a line from her debut solo single  which the new video plugs.

She declared on Twitter: "Forgive us for what we have done, 'cause we're young."

A pal said last night: "Tulisa is still devastated by what has happened and is keeping a low profile. She is mortified that so many people have seen what is such a private thing.

"She wants to move on and put this behind her  and hopes fans will now concentrate on her music."

The Sun told yesterday how the ex-boyfriend Tulisa says appears in the sex tape with her  Justin Edwards  told her lawyers last year he had no copies of it.

The rapper, who calls himself MC Ultra, said: "Even if I did, which I do not, I would have no desire to publish them, simply because I would find that ungentlemanly. I was brought up better than that."

l.holmwood@the-sun.co.uk

Hollyoaks' Ash Kane in bug battle

articles.articlebody:
GORGEOUS Jorgie Porter is nautical but nice in a navy-striped bikini  as she prepares to make waves in tomorrow's Dancing On Ice final.

The 24-year-old Hollyoaks star  Theresa McQueen in the soap  flaunted ship-shape curves before the skating showdown.

Jorgie, who partners pro Matt Evers, 36, will tackle the most dangerous stunt seen on the ITV show as she is thrown into the air by male skaters.

Hopefully the performance will be the only thing that's Jor dropping...

article.caption: Tulisa's latest sex tape
2Shoes 'to lose 2 stone after scoring record deal'
Cowell: Sex tape Tulisa hasn't blown her job
X Factor is going back to basics
Amanda Holden: Sir Tom could be dead in a week

articles.articlebody:
SIMON Cowell's new TV rival Will.i.am has blasted The X Factor for letting down acts created by the show.

The Black Eyed Peas star  a coach on BBC1's The Voice  laid into the ITV series just hours before his show goes head-to-head with Cowell's other vehicle, Britain's Got Talent.

He reckons teen Cher Lloyd, who came fourth in The X Factor in 2010 and is signed to Cowell's Syco label, hasn't been allowed to reach her potential.

That's despite her debut album spawning two UK top ten hits including a No1.

Will said: "I love Cher Lloyd. She should have been the biggest star in the world. She should have had the coolest freaking music.

"It's like they put them out, juice them, juice them, juice them, and give people something to watch on TV.

"Then, who is making sure she has the right material? That is wrong."

Cher's album gets a US release next month but Will still reckons he will be more dedicated to helping the acts he guides on the UK version of The Voice, which kicks off tonight at 7pm.

He said: "I told every person on my team that I am going to try my hardest to see their career is jumpstarted or revitalised regardless of whether they win or not."

Will.i.am described the panel on The Voice  which also includes Tom Jones, Jessie J and The Script's Danny O'Donoghue  as like "hungry people fighting over a steak, the fangs are drawn". But the US producer does fear ruining a contestant's chances in the industry if he gets it wrong.

He said: "There is a fear of that. We could mess up these people's careers." Will.i.am, who is pals with Cheryl Cole, who he manages, admitted he would stop at nothing to win the show but was tight-lipped about which stars he will be inviting on to the series.

He said: "I don't want to reveal my tricks. I'm just trying to do as much as I can, I swear to God, including technology and people."

He confessed that show bosses asked him and Jessie J to ramp up their banter during filming to boost ratings but both refused. Will said: "Before the cameras went on before the first day they asked us to turn it up for TV and Jessie told me, 'I'm not going to do that for TV ratings, that's fake.'

"We said it to each other, then two days in the crews were like, 'Thanks a lot'  but then the banter was real."

Despite claiming he is mentoring four potential superstars, Will.i.am is worried about competing against "legend" Tom Jones because he knows every trick in the book.

He said: "I think I have about four people who are really big, out of the ten in my team  four big global artists.

"Out of all the singers, I am nervous about Tom's team. Me and my team, we have a lot of homework to do for the real live battles."

But he reckons TV viewers will vote for the acts purely based on their voice  after the huge success of Brit Adele.

He claims she forced people to forget about "the industry mould of the model figure".
articles.teaser: MUSIC mogul's TV rival has blasted The X Factor for letting down acts created by the show
articles.headline: Will.i.am: Simon lets down stars
articles.subdeck: Let down ... Will.i.am has hit out at Simon Cowell for not guiding the show's stars

article.caption: Simon Cowell: Voice rivalry is waste of telly fee
Alesha Dixon's sky-thigh look for BGT
David Walliams: Fans always ask me if Simon likes men or laydees
Amanda Holden: Sir Tom could be dead in a week

articles.articlebody:
BRITAIN'S Got Talent kicks off tonight and it's full of surprises.

Judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are even lost for words at some of the wackier acts.

Zany Denis Egel travelled from Germany to sing Evanescence's Bring Me To Life wearing a black cloak, but threw it off to reveal a gold outfit, before releasing four giant gold sails from behind him.

Unfortunately one sail fell to the floor  prompting hosts Ant and Dec to intervene.

And things didn't go well for an African stilt dancer called Buba, from Margate in Kent who failed to impress the panel.

Simon deadpanned: "For me it was like having some insane nightmare."

But Amanda couldn't hold back the tears when a coachload of unemployed teenage lads from the South Wales valleys called Only Boys Aloud, bowled over all the judges with their performance.

In stark contrast BGT new girl Alesha told of the show's grossest moment  when a man bit into a cockroach on stage.

She said: "I was like, that's one thing you never thought you'd see in your lifetime."

She added that the chemistry between the judges was good  though they do bicker.

She told Capital Radio: "There is this preconceived idea that judging panels don't get along but this is my second one and on both of them I've got along with everyone."

article.caption: Matthew Wolfenden is singin' in the reign
DOI Jen: I wannabe Spice Girl after Ice Girl
Chico's pecsy and he knows it
Matthew Wolfenden: Charley was a skate help
Louie Spence: Chico has no chance of winning Dancing On Ice
Hollyoaks' Ash Kane in bug battle
Jorgie Porter is nautical but nice

articles.articlebody:
DANCING On Ice star Jorgie Porter will perform the show's most dangerous ever stunt in a bid to win tomorrow night's Dancing On Ice final.

The Hollyoaks actress, 24, will be thrown up in the air by three male ice skaters, who will then spin around before catching her.

It is so dangerous that they have been practising with a carpet  which they keep dropping.

Until now Jorgie has wowed judges Robin Cousins, Katarina Witt and Louie Spence with her fearless approach to lifts and stunts with partner Matt Evers.

But the last lady celebrity skating in the competition admits she is suffering the first bout of fear about the daring trick for her final routine as she goes up against Chico Slimani and Matthew Wolfenden.

Injured skater Sylvain Longchambon, boyfriend of Jorgie's co-star Jennifer Metcalfe, is even making a comeback for the special stunt after recovering from a severe arm injury picked up in training.

Professional Mark Hanretty will also skate with them.

Jorgie, who has chosen Fame for her final dance, said: "There is definitely some scary stuff with my routine. We practised with a carpet and it absolutely collapsed and fell on the floor.

"I looked at it and went  'That's me!' I'm glad we practised with that first.

"There are three of them in a line, Sylvain, Matt and Mark, and I'm lying across them then they throw me in the air and spin around and catch me."

Jorgie was so terrified after they dropped the carpet that she made Jayne Torvill prove it was safe.

She said: "I was scared so I made Jayne do it first as well. She was really up for it. And she wanted to do the other parts too but the physio wouldn't let her.

"I've never said no, I've always been quite fearless throughout the show.

"But I thought they were lying when they were saying what they wanted to do with me. I thought, 'Is this a joke?'"

She added: "I still can't believe I'm the last girl standing.

"I think in days or weeks to come I'll be like, 'Oh my God, I did this'. At the minute I am just taking it in.

"I can feel myself crying my eyes out no matter what happens."
articles.teaser: DANCING On Ice beauty will perform the skating show's most dangerous stunt yet
articles.headline: Dancers practised throwing me in air using a carpet  and dropped it!

Take That plan massive cover-up

articles.articlebody:
MARK OWEN has found another way to keep himself busy while his bandmate Gary Barlow organises a party for the Queen and judges on The X Factor.

The Take That hero has been in the studio working on material for up-and-coming young pop stars.

His publishing company  who pull in the money from his songs being used in adverts, TV and film  have been getting him together with new talent.

He's a very busy boy at the moment. As Bizarre revealed earlier in the week, he has been working on a new solo album too.

A source said: "Since Take That reformed back in 2005 Mark has taken a much bigger share of songwriting responsibilities than before.

"It is really paying off now with his publishing deal.

"He has become an in-demand co-writer and producer after playing a key role in creating songs like Shine.

"With Take That on a break it's the ideal time for Mark to show his talents behind the scenes. He's picked a couple of acts he thinks have potential."

Good on him. He's a sound bloke too, so he'll get the best out of the people he works with.
